text: The International Congress on Industrial and Applied Mathematics (ICIAM) is an international conference about applied mathematics. It is organized by the International Council on Industrial and Applied Mathematics. ==Locations== This congress is held once in 4 years since 1987.McKenna, J., & Temam, R. (Eds.). (1988). ICIAM'87: Proceedings of the First International Conference on Industrial and Applied Mathematics (Vol. 34). SIAM.O'Malley, R. E. (Ed.). (1992). ICIAM 91: Proceedings of the Second International Conference on Industrial and Applied Mathematics (Vol. 61). SIAM.Neunzert, H., Klar, A., & Struckmeier, J. (1995). In ICIAM 95: Proceedings of the Third International Congress on Industrial and Applied Mathematics. Kirchgaessner, K., Ed.Hunt, J. C. R., & Ball, J. M. (Eds.). (2000). ICIAM 1999: Proceedings of the 4th International Congress on Industrial and Applied Mathematics. Oxford University Press. One congress takes about a week. The program includes several invited talks.Jeltsch, R., & Wanner, G. (2009). ICIAM 07: 6th International Conference on Industrial and Applied Mathematics, Zürich, Switzerland, 16-20 July 2007: Invited Lectures. European Mathematical Society.Hill, J. M., & Moore, R. (Eds.). (2004). Applied mathematics entering the 21st century: invited talks from the ICIAM 2003 Congress (Vol. 116). SIAM. Year Country City 2023 Waseda University, Tokyo 2019 ValenciaDonat, R. (2019). The Spanish Society for Applied Mathematics and ICIAM 2019–Valencia. EMS Newsletter, 3(111), 45-47. 2015 Beijing 2011 VancouverStettner, Ł. (2012). 7th International Congress on Industrial and Applied Mathematics–ICIAM 2011. Mathematica Applicanda, 39(2), 115-120. 2007 ZurichBenner, P. (2007). Model reduction at ICIAM'07. SIAM News, 40(8), 31-33.de Mestre, N. (2007). Report on ICIAM 2007 in Zurich.
